questiontext.text:
Initial concepts Innledende konsepter

Determinants reminder Påminnelse om determinanter

A square matrix possesses an associated determinant. Unlike a matrix, which is an array of numbers, a determinant has a single value. En kvadratisk matrise har en tilknyttet determinant. I motsetning til en matrise, som er en rekke tall, har en determinant en enkel verdi.

A two by two matrix \(C=\left[\begin{array}{ll}c_{11}&c_{12}\\ c_{21}&c_{22}\end{array}\right]\) has an associated determinant En to gangerto matrise \(C=\left[\begin{array}{ll}c_{11}&c_{12}\\ c_{21}&c_{22}\end{array}\right]\) har en tilknyttet determinant

\[\mathrm{det}(C)=\begin{vmatrix}c_{11}&c_{12}\\ c_{21}&c_{22}\end{vmatrix} = c_{11}c_{22}-c_{21}c_{12}\]

(Note square or round brackets denote a matrix, straight vertical lines denote a determinant.) (Merk at firkant- eller runde parenteser indikerer en matrise, rette vertikale streker indikerer en determinant.)

A three by three matrix has an associated determinant En tre ganger tre matrise har en tilknyttet determinant

\[\det (C)=\begin{vmatrix}c_{11}&c_{12}&c_{13}\\ c_{21}&c_{22}&c_{23}\\ c_{31}&c_{32}&c_{33}\end{vmatrix}\]

Among other ways, this determinant can be evaluated by an “expansion about the top row”: Blant andre måter kan denne determinanten beregnes ved en "utvidelse om øverste rad":

\[\det(C)=c_{11}\begin{vmatrix}c_{22}&c_{23}\\ c_{32}&c_{33}\end{vmatrix} - c_{12}\begin{vmatrix}c_{21}&c_{23}\\ c_{31}&c_{33}\end{vmatrix} + c_{13}\begin{vmatrix}c_{21}&c_{22}\\ c_{31}&c_{32}\end{vmatrix}\]

Note the minus sign in the second term. Merk minus tegnet i det andre leddet.

A matrix such as \(A=\left[\begin{array}{cc}4&8\\ 1&2\end{array}\right]\) which has zero determinant is called a singular matrix. Matrices with a non-zero determinant are non-singular . The key factor to be aware of is as follows: En matrise som \(A=\left[\begin{array}{cc}4&8\\ 1&2\end{array}\right]\) som har en null determinant kalles en singular matrise. Matriser med en ikke-null determinant kalles ikke-singulære matriser. Det viktige faktumet som skal være klar for leseren er som følger:

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

Any non-singular \(n\times n\) matrix \(C\), for which \(\text{det}(C)\neq 0 \), possesses an inverse \(C^{-1}\) i.e. Enhver ikke-singulær \(n\times n\) matrise \(C\), for hvilken \(\text{det}(C)\neq 0 \), har en invers \(C^{-1}\) dvs.

\[CC^{-1}=C^{-1}C=I \quad \text{where } I \text{ denotes the } n\times n \text{ identity matrix.}\] \[CC^{-1}=C^{-1}C=I \quad \text{der } I \text{ er en } n\times n \text{ identitetsmatrise.}\]

A singular matrix does not possess an inverse. En singulær matrise har ikke en invers.
